title: Remainers don't want time to scrutinise the Withdrawal Bill. They want to humiliate the PM
text:
House of Commons legend tells of a dark time, when the life of an MP was a lot harder than it is today. In gloomy corners of the Palace of Westminster there are still whispers of the days when Members would be shut away for days on end, never seeing the sunlight or their families because they had to hang around Bill committees just in case an unexpected vote was called at the end of a three-hour speech.

Most people have an understanding of what “filibuster” means and many probably still associate the practice with the Commons. But in one of the most radical – and not much noticed outside Westminster – constitutional overhauls undertaken by the newly-elected Labour government of 1997, the practice...
description: House of Commons legend tells of a dark time, when the life of an MP was a lot harder than it is today.
